description: Sven Halek discreetly distributes mesh network access instructions and documented evidence of Congress abuses to trusted neighborhood representatives, urging them to bypass centralized control and share the truth.

Neighborhoods rapidly install mesh networking nodes, creating a parallel communication and resource-sharing network independent from both the Council and Congress. Communities coordinate directly, easing shortages and reducing system chaos.

Local truth commissions form using the mesh to broadcast testimonies of harm caused by the BCI and by post-amnesty favoritism. The new transparency provokes both outrage and renewed solidarity citywide.

Congress leaders attempt to block the mesh but meet resistance as Oksana Lintz sides with the grassroots. More neighborhoods declare independence from the Congress, relying fully on their own assemblies.

Widespread celebrations mark the emergence of autonomous local governance. Survivors and activists credit both Sven’s intervention and Halden’s warnings for bringing about the collapse of centralized power.
